N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 10 ยง 425.15 - Activities

State Regulations

The operator, directly or through the managed care plan
that referred the registrant to the adult day health care program, must: (a) ensure that activities are an integral
part of the program, are age appropriate, and reflect the registrants'
individual interests and cultural backgrounds in coordination with the
registrant's person-centered care plan; (b) ensure that activities involve
integration in and full access of individuals to the greater community, control
personal resources and ability to engage in community life to the same degree
of access as individuals not receiving home and community-based
services; (c) ensure that
activities are designed to enhance registrant participation in the program, home life and community; (d) involve appropriate volunteers and volunteer groups in the program, unless
prohibited by law; (e) provide
sufficient equipment and supplies for the operation of the activity
program; (f) provide or arrange
for transportation to and from community events and outings; and
(g) ensure that activities are included as
part of each person-centered care plan. Notes
